title: Morbidly obese shoplifter caught on video leading gang of thieves in slowest shoplifting imaginable
description:
Quick getaway. When you steal or rob someone, you are supposed to make a QUICK getaway. You take the stolen merchandise and leave the scene of the crime as fast as possible. Therein lies the rub in this piece of content. The 400-pound behemoth of a woman was moving as fast as she could.

You may ask yourself, "Brodigan, how did someone that large get around unnoticeable enough to steal all that merch?" She and her gang of Berthas robbed a Burlington, which is owned by Bain Capital Partners. My guess is they were very noticeable. But, corporate zero-tolerance policies. Know what I mean?

— (@)

Shout out to my man who saw these three units leaving the store and remembered to do it for the content: "Damn, look at these people stealing! Say hi to the camera!"

The Daily Mail is reporting that Instagram account @ppv_tahoe published the original video and mentioned besides being thieving chubbers, they parked their red Dodge Charger in the handicapped spot WITHOUT the proper tags. This leads us to the under $1,000 question. How does a woman with that big of a cottage cheese butt, who is so fat she has other fat women orbiting her like she is a planet who eats smaller planets, fit into a Dodge Charger? Unless there is a forklift coming to pick her up. It wouldn't be the first time we've seen a forklift take part in a robbery.

She's got the fattest ass, is what I'm saying.

Police are reviewing the video, which provides a clear view of their faces and the license plate. No word on if the police plan on calling for backup from neighboring counties. This woman can be hungry and dangerous. I don't know how many tazer it'll take to put her down.

I just want the mugshot.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Watch: MSNBC rushes to shield Joe Biden from Hunter debacle, reminds America Joe refuses to acknowledge his granddaughter
description:
Two things to consider. The first, it's clear the Biden campaign believes "Joe is a good family man and loving grandfather" is something to campaign on. Remember, it's not that Joe and Hunter Biden are corrupt. It's that Joe loves his son so much he would do anything for him. The other is that at one point on Wednesday, Hunter's sweetheart plea deal was called off, but as of 1:05 PM it's back on.

While still in "defend Joe at all costs" mode, MSNBC's Kelly O'Donnell said that OF COURSE, Hunter would be on the phone with Joe on the day he is scheduled to sign a plea deal. They talk all the time. Also, "The President always makes a point that he speaks to all of his grandchildren every day."

— (@)

Are we forgetting somebody?

KJP gives terrible response to Joe Biden's refusal to acknowledge Hunter's love child with a stripper as his granddaughter

Ron DeSantis GOES THERE, blasts Joe Biden refusing to acknowledge his granddaughter in South Carolina speech

Awkward video resurfaces of what Joe Biden does with his grandkids as media defends him denying Hunter's lovechild

Joe Biden has seven grandchildren. But the seventh is from his son Hunter Biden knocking up his former assistant. There was a court case where Hunter, the president of the United States' son, refused child support and refused to let his daughter be acknowledged as a Biden.

It has since been worked out in court where Hunter will pay child support, but the girl is still forbidden from using Joe Biden's last name even though she is Hunter Biden's kid.

Reports say the granddaughter, 6, loves playing with her cousins, is learning to ride a bike, and one day wants to learn to hunt like her mom. She also knows her father is Hunter Biden and her grandfather is the president of the United States and speaks about the two of them frequently.

Joe Biden, the president of the United States and her paw paw, wants nothing to do with her. The White House has been ordered to never bring her up. The SAME White House that is trying to make "Joe talks to all his grandkids every day" a thing.

— (@)


— (@)

Oh, and as for why there may have been concern or question IF Joe Biden would speak to Hunter on the phone today? If I were to guess...

— (@)

Joe Biden sucks at being a family guy as much as he does being a president.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Watch: Because we owe it to the people, here's Vivek Ramaswamy spitting bars and rapping Eminem's "Lose Yourself"
description:
The political world has been put in time out while everyone figures out the Hunter Biden plea deal. It may or may not have been rejected. And if it has, it may or may not still be rejected by the end of the day. While Joe Biden directs the lawyers and the DOJ to figure it out and sweeten the deal, here's Vivek Ramaswamy spitting hot fire on the mic.

To be more precise, it's Da Vek. And he isn't spitting bars about ESG scores. He's covering Eminem's "Lose Yourself." Dropping the mic like he dropped Don Lemon's career at CNN.

— (@)

This is Vivek when he was attending Harvard, auditioning to open up for Busta Rhymes. He tells Politico, "I saw myself, honestly, making it big through American capitalism, and that’s why the Eminem story spoke to me."

The presidential candidate says he was drawn to the rapper because, while Vivek didn’t grow up in a trailer, he also didn’t grow up in the same circumstances that most of his peers at Harvard did, either.

"He’s growing up in the trailers, with a single mom, and he wants to make it. He’s going to use the moment to do it. He feels like he’s going to use the moment to do it, he seizes it and then he makes it happen, and I thought it was a pretty cool story."

Now we know where Vivek gets his skills when it comes to call and response and battling rival MCs.

Unfortunately, we all know what happens next. 217 journalismers are currently on the phone looking to get a comment from Eminem bashing Vivek and all conservatives. "Eminem claps back against Ramaswamy" the content will read. Heaven forbid they let a cool, humanizing moment go by.

>

<

title: Watch: Thugs attempt to rob a pot dispensary, run like cowards when the employee fights them with his bong
description:
It’s safe to say that no business, small or large, is safe from the rash of crimes sweeping across the country, mostly in liberal cities. Organized smash-and-grab robberies have become a popular past-time activity in many areas. Even CNN was put in a position where they couldn't ignore the problem.

What are business owners supposed to do? Well, they can fight. Now, I don’t know if the man in this video is the owner of the business—if he’s not, he definitely deserves a raise—but he’s willing to throw down to keep it safe, regardless. And when a trio of hooded-up douchelords come running in to steal some of that sticky-icky-icky, our dude behind the counter isn’t having it for a second!

— (@)

Duuuuuuude.

The thugs outnumbered the dude and were armed with what looked like an economy-size thing of pepper spray. Yet all it took was some backbone and a glass pipe, and we saw that the thugs were not only scumbags, they were pussies too. A point our dude emphasized when he flexed on them.

The only thing this video is missing, besides a cameo from Hunter Biden's lawyer, is audio. I would have loved to have her our dude yell "El-kaBONG" as he smashed it upside one of the three robbers' noggin.

— (@)

You would think now that pot is legal in most places, dispensaries would be the safest place. Shockingly, that is not the case. People who run the dispensaries said their lives were less at risk when they were selling drugs illegally.

Pot shops are all independently owned and have not been gobbled up by global corporations yet. Had that been the case, our friend would have been fired for violating some "zero tolerance" policy. Instead, I'm sure his boss gave him an ounce and told him to take the rest of the day off.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Watch: Ice Cube blasts Democrats failing Black America as he cruises South Central with Tucker Carlson
description:
When Ice Cube said today feels like a good day to burn a bridge or two (shout out 311) and go on a podcast tour to get things off his chest, I wish I had assumed that meant Tucker Carlson. I would have been popping popcorn this entire time.

To be clear, no, the rapper/actor/mogul is not a secret conservative We have a habit of lumping people in as "right-wing" if they say a single thing we agree with. Cube, however, is an ally in that he is speaking out about how progressives failed his community. it presents an opportunity if conservatives are smart enough to take it.

The rapper gets told to "stay in his lane," which makes him the perfect first guest for Tucker's "Stay In Your Lane" series.

— (@)

Los Angeles hasn't changed much if at all in the thirty years since Cube first blew up with NWA. Another thing that hasn't changed is, ironically enough, the political leanings of the politicians who keep getting elected.

Woke leftists just write checks to organizations like the Black Lives Matter Political Organization to signal their virtue.

OR, as Cube alludes, they at least say they are going to.

The kicker is a lot of people saying "I'll give them money," but they don't even give me money. They just get the article wrote. Everybody thinks they're great And they never even give the money.”

All for the best, since out of the hundreds of millions raised to support the community, little of it has found its way to the community.

Most of the time a lot of people are siphoning that money off the top.

It's been fun watching Cube's... I guess transformation? As an oldhead who grew up in the 80s and 90s, Ice Cube always came across as the most politically minded of NWA, and NOT in a secret conservative way.

Then in 2020, when Cube had a list of policies for his community he wanted to discuss with the two presidential candidates, the Trump campaign was the only one who reached out. Joe Biden saying "you ain't black" if you don't vote for him no questions asked turned out to be a plank in the Democrat campaign platform. And after getting continued attacks for not falling in line with the Democrat party and having his personal medical decisions made public for not complying with the Democrat narrative, Cube's tired of being told to stay in his lane.

Tucker says next he'll be sitting down with Ice Cube in his studio for a full interview. If Cube doesn't have Carlson lay down some rhymes, then I don't see the point of any of this.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Here we go: BLM footage gets edited out of Jason Aldean's "Small Town" video on YouTube
description:
Amid leftist media outrage over Jason Aldean’s song “Try That in a Small Town,” it appears someone had edited a part of the video that illustrated the crime and riots that were broadcast into our homes in 2020. Six seconds worth. We haven't been analyzing the video like it's the Zapruder film, but the journalismers at the Washington Post have.

In their most recent piece of content created that they pass off as "news," the video is now SIX SECONDS shorter than when it was first uploaded to YouTube on July 14th. Those six seconds were from a Fox 5 Atlanta news clip about the firey but mostly peaceful riots that took place three years ago.

Portions of that clip appeared in the original music video twice. At one point, it was projected onto the exterior wall of a Tennessee County courthouse that was also featured in the Hannah Montana movie.

It is unclear when the video was edited. Or why. Or who called for it. There is a very good chance Fox 5 Atlanta put in a copyright claim with YouTube. And while the six seconds would fall under "fair use," Louder with Crowder knows firsthand that YouTube ignores laws and doesn't apply guidelines fairly when their progressives have sand in their vaginas.

In response to the Left and the media (but I repeat myself) trying to get the song canceled, Middle America has rallied around the artist. Audio and video streams have increased by 999%. Sales of the song jumped from 1,000 units to 228,000 units. And it's #2 on the Billboard Hot 100.

Aldean, up until this point, has refused to back down. He said in a statement when the controversy first popped off that there isn’t a single video clip that isn’t real news footage and the attacks against him "...are not only meritless but dangerous." This past weekend, he told an audience full of fans "...if people don’t like what you say, they try and make sure that they can cancel you. Which means, try and ruin your life, ruin everything," before playing the song live.

Let's hope this isn't the beginning sign of Aldean bending the knee. And that someone at BMG made the call when they got the YouTube notice as an unfortunate knee-jerk response. The Aldeans didn't bend the knee when the Left and the media (again, I repeat myself) lashed out at Brittany's common sense views on biology. I can't see them bending the knee here.

If it is, Aldean needs to take a closer look at who is on his side and who hates him. HINT: the song didn't see a 999% increase (that's three 9s) because Washington Post journalismers or CMT employees are streaming the song.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.
